Background.text: Accidental digital self-injection of epinephrine from an EpiPen.

Clinical_Features.text: Puncture wound with delayed capillary refill (vasoconstriction)

Differential_Diagnosis.text:
Injection of other medication
Retained
foreign body
Allergic reaction
Cellulitis

Evaluation.text: Typically a clinical diagnosis (no testing required)

Management.text:
Observation for 2 hours after injection
[1]
If continued ischemia symptoms after 2 hrs, inject
phentolamine
into the ischemic area (see procedure below)

Equipment_Needed.text:
10cc syringe
Phentolamine mesylate
1-2% lidocaine (WITHOUT epinephrine)
25g needle

Technique.text:
Dilute 1.5mg of
phentolamine
mesilate in 1mL of 2% lidocaine.
Inject subQ into the site and stop when tissue turns pink again.
Observe and repeat as necessary.
